info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 10:34PM CDT until March 31 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN PERRY COUNTY... At 1034 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 9 miles east of Heiberger, or 12 miles northeast of Marion, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Oakmulgee. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
